model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
I went to another martial arts class and had a blast.
That's great, were there a lot of students today? I've been at home working on a project.
Quite a few, but it wasn't too crowded. It was a nice change of scenery. What kind of project are you working on?
I'm sure the student appreciate that. You teach as a group as apposed to one-on-one right? And one of the companies I work for had their system hit with a virus so I've been upgraded their software to debug the system.
I teach group classes and one on one, but I was the student today. I specialize in jiu-jitsu but today I got to be the student in a taekwondo class. 
That's even better, learning is a life-long journey. How are you class on martial art history? When you have time teach me too, I'd love to learn. 
It's been a little stressful lately, because finals are coming up...but I'm confident in that class. I could've aced it before I even started! I'll definitely get started with you after finals.
Ahaha we;; for someone who's so passionate about martial arts I'm not surprised. Great, I'll try to be the best student I can. I'm starving, think I should grab some take-out from Sufi?

[MEMORY]
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'Favorite Restaurants and Teaching Martial Arts', 'Related Summaries': 'Speaker A and Speaker B share their favorite restaurants and discuss their love for teaching and learning martial arts.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker A: Ahh my favorite restaurant is Taco Bell! A little less fancy lol. ### Speaker B: Oh wow, we really went there okay lol. I'm sure you have to jiu-jitsu the calories off haha. How has the martial arts teaching been? ### Speaker A: I love teaching! I also love learning and it's so much fun being a teacher and a student! ### Speaker B: I'm glad to hear! I recently signed up for a class which teaches the history of martial arts. It's online and its pretty fun and laidback.' }(2) {'Related Topics': 'Class on Martial Arts History', 'Related Summaries': 'Speaker A mentions enrolling in a class on the history of martial arts, which interests both speakers.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker B: Yes, I have thought about it.  To be honest, I haven't done it because I sort of feel like it would be disloyal to my dogs back in England, as weird as that might sound. ### Speaker A: I started my class for history of martial arts and really love it  ### Speaker B: Oh really? Is it an easy elective? ### Speaker A: It's pretty complicated, but really interesting - I think you'd enjoy it!' }
```
